intro: Hieracium subramosum subsp. holopleurum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The subspecies holopleurum is distinguished by its more narrowly shaped leaves compared to other subspecies of H. subramosum. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant is often found in temperate regions and is relatively common in its native range.
